_comment: Created by ianb on 30/01/2015 15:41:25 using v2.3
title: How has prevalence of diabetes changed over time?
analysis_commentary: Diabetes prevalence is calculated using patient registrations from primary care and patient registrations from secondary care, where the patients GP practice participated in the audit (in England and Wales). We observe a slight decrease in prevalence from 4.59% in 2010/11 to 4.87% in 2012/13. The increase is mainly due to an increase in Type 2 diabetes prevalence (from 4.1% to 4.38%); Type 1 diabetes prevalence was around 0.4% in all years.
data_source: National Diabetes Audit, HQIP, IC, Diabetes UK
